content: later writings, no longer employ term “hermeneutics” > I left an earlier standpoint (Standpunkt), not to exchange it w/ another one, but because former standpoint (Standort) was merely a way-station (Aufenthalt) along a way
linkedContent: later writings, no longer employ term “hermeneutics” > I left an earlier standpoint (Standpunkt), not to exchange it w/ another one, but because former standpoint (Standort) was merely a way-station (Aufenthalt) along a way

content: gesture (Gebärde) (gathering of a bearing [eines Tragens]) helps us experience (erfahren) truly what is to be said [about language?] [?], you intentionally avoid saying [cf. HASD]: our bearing (unseres Tragens, unseres Betragens), what truly bears (eigentlich Tragende), bears itself toward us (uns sich erst zu-trägt)
linkedContent: gesture (Gebärde) (gathering of a bearing [eines Tragens]) helps us experience (erfahren) truly what is to be said [about language?] [?], you intentionally avoid saying [cf. content: our counterbearing (Entgegentragen) already borne (eingetragen hat) into the gift it bears for us (in den Zutrag)
linkedContent: our counterbearing (Entgegentragen) already borne (eingetragen hat) into the gift it bears for us (in den Zutrag)

content: look for essence of gesture in a beholding that is invisible (unsichtbaren Schauen) [moral image of thought?], bears itself to encounter (entgegenträgt) emptiness (Leere), so that mountains appear > that emptiness same as nothingness, essential being (Wesende) we search to think: the other of all that is present & absent (das Andere zu allem An- und Abwesenden)

content: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)
linkedContent: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)

content: Heidegger has strived for an original appropriation (ursprüngliche Aneignung anstreben): whose success can & should be disputed
linkedContent: Heidegger has strived for an original appropriation (ursprüngliche Aneignung anstreben): whose success can & should be disputed

content: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding
linkedContent: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding

content: paths of thinking are not like roads, which follow a plan
linkedContent: paths of thinking are not like roads, which follow a plan

content: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]

content: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages

content: on the unavoidability of metaphysics, via Kant, its unbroken rule (ungebrochene Herrschaft) [mastery] establishes itself where we don’t expect it [overcoming metaphysics?]

content: must guard (hüten) the ways toward language > enough just to build a bypath (Seitenpfad) toward the ways [arrival?] > speaking of hints seems to indicate (weisen) a trail (Spur) [trace] of such a path (Pfad] [bypath to way]

content: hints [traces?]: enigmatic (rätselhaft), Sie winken uns zu, Sie winken ab [hints hint toward us, hint away] > “they beckon ourselves toward that from which they unexpectedly (unversehens) [unforeseeably] bear themselves toward us” > hints & gestures not signs, chiffres (latter have there habitat in metaphysics) [cf. p. 27] > hints/gestures belong to totally other (ganz anderen) Wesensraum [realm of reality?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: ambiguity of “Being,” not metaphysical representation, but the presence of Being, presence of the two-fold (Zwiefalt), Being and beings > if we heed (beachten) this [ambiguity of twofold], phrase never becomes catchword (Schlagwort)
linkedContent: ambiguity of “Being,” not metaphysical representation, but the presence of Being, presence of the two-fold (Zwiefalt), Being and beings > if we heed (beachten) this [ambiguity of twofold], phrase never becomes catchword (Schlagwort)

content: word of Japaner still withheld, will bring us an unexpected surprise (unverhoffte Überraschung)
linkedContent: word of Japaner still withheld, will bring us an unexpected surprise (unverhoffte Überraschung)

content: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)
linkedContent: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)

content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

linkedContent: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

content: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]

content: we’re all clumsy questioners (unbehlofener Frager) [following unwritten prescription (ungeschriebenen Vorschrift)], despite much care, keep overlooking essentials [arrival?] > we notice quite late our carelessness re: words, because language is more powerful/weightier than we are

content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: the way I use (gebrauchen) words
linkedContent: the way I use (gebrauchen) words

content: [re: “Expression and Meaning (Ausdruck und Bedeutung [double takes on Erscheinung]”] I was concerned to make visible (sichtbar machen) das ganz Andere [the totally other], which [at that time], I had only an obscure (dunkel) or confused intimation (verworren Geahnte) [Derrida beyond Heidegger: can’t make totally other visible]

content: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)

content: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

content: to think Greeks in even more Greek manner doesn’t mean better than them: great thinking understands itself best, i.e. understands itself, w/in limits set for it (zugemessenen Grenzen) > to think more originally than Greeks: to think the unthought clearing (Lichten), the occurrence (Ereignis) [?] of emergence (Hervorkommen) into openness (Lichte) [?], unconcealedness (appearance of that which is present)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: to think Greeks in even more Greek manner doesn’t mean better than them: great thinking understands itself best, i.e. understands itself, w/in limits set for it (zugemessenen Grenzen) > to think more originally than Greeks: to think the unthought clearing (Lichten), the occurrence (Ereignis) [?] of emergence (Hervorkommen) into openness (Lichte) [?], unconcealedness (appearance of that which is present)

content: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

content: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]
linkedContent: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]

content: So wäre denn der Mensch als der Botengänger der Botschaft der Entbergung der Zwiefalt zugleich der Grenzgänger des Grenzenlosen [man as the boarder-goer of the borderless, since he bears the message of the two-fold’s unconcealment] > man seeks the boundary’s mystery (Geheimnis der Grenze), can’t be hidden (bergen) anywhere but in the voice (Stimme), die sein Wesen be-stimmt (tunes/determines) [phonocentrism]
linkedContent: So wäre denn der Mensch als der Botengänger der Botschaft der Entbergung der Zwiefalt zugleich der Grenzgänger des Grenzenlosen [man as the boarder-goer of the borderless, since he bears the message of the two-fold’s unconcealment] > man seeks the boundary’s mystery (Geheimnis der Grenze), can’t be hidden (bergen) anywhere but in the voice (Stimme), die sein Wesen be-stimmt (tunes/determines) [phonocentrism]

content: [re: method of “Expression and Appearance”] never did more than follow a faint trail (Wegspur) > die Spur (dark, perplexing, lightning-sharp, sudden insight [Einblick] [instant]): almost imperceptible promise (vernehmbares Versprechen) announcing (ankündete) we’d be set free into open (ins Freie) > eluded every effort to say it

content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: language as Koto ba > Koto: Ereignis (of lightening message of grace), that which gives delight, itself, that which, uniquely in each unrepeatable moment (unwiederholbaren Augenblick) comes to radiance (Scheinen) in fullness of its grace [instant of gift]

content: grace, Anmut, Greek charis, which is called tiktousa (brings forward & forth), like German word dichten, tihton > graciousness as the poetical, das Quellen der Botschaft des Entbergens der Zwiefalt

content: Koto: the happening holding sway (waltende Ereignen) > language as Koto ba: the petals (Blütenblätter) that stem from Koto > wondrous, names something other than Sprache, glossa, lingua, langue > Heidegger the inquirer prefers Sage, saying, probably means the same as “show (zeigen)”: let appear and let shine—but in the manner of hinting > Japaner has arrived home through beckoning hint of Koto ba

content: thinking look (Anleitung) into Sage only beginning of path that takes us back out (zürucknimmt) of metaphysical representations in das Achten auf die Winke jener Botschaft, deren Botengänger wir eigens werden möchten [in the attention/heeding of hints, traces, whose message we would want to properly bear?]

content: one’s own effort alone is never adequate

content: [Heidegger doesn’t want to publish lecture “Logos”? transcripts would distort its saying—anti-supplement?]
linkedContent: [Heidegger doesn’t want to publish lecture “Logos”? transcripts would distort its saying—anti-supplement?]

content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

content: [on dialogue, that it must always remain coming, never arrive, and there will be much silence, but not the obnoxiousness of talking about silence]
linkedContent: [on dialogue, that it must always remain coming, never arrive, and there will be much silence, but not the obnoxiousness of talking about silence]

content: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]
linkedContent: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? content: shine/still/silence
linkedContent: shine/still/silence

content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

content: [bypassing nihilism of the passing of Es ist] passing of past as gathering of what endures (Währenden), endures as what grants endurance (Gewährende)
